StoryText: Dad cooked lasagne, my favourite! But what's this on the side... broccoli?
Question: I hate broccoli! What should I do?

OptionText.Text: Thank Dad for cooking, and eat all the broccoli.
Tell Dad that he should know that I hate broccoli!
Hide some of the broccoli under my knife and fork.

OptionResult.Result: Dad doesn't cook that often, so I put on a brave face and tried to eat all the broccoli, every last scrap. I ended up puking a bit... and dad was a little upset, though proud I'd tried.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: Dad cooked my favourite meal and, although I tried to eat all my broccoli to stop myself seeming ungrateful, it backfired and I was ill. Dad was a little sad, but impressed too.

OptionResult.Result: When I told Dad that I hated broccoli, he looked surprised and a little hurt. He then gave me a long talk about healthy eating. By the time I got to each the lasagne, it was cold! Yuk!
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: I shouldn't have been so mean to my dad about the broccoli today. He was sad, and I had to each some of the broccoli anyway. Yuk!

OptionResult.Result: I gobbled up the lasagne that Dad cooked and it was delicious. I managed to hide half the broccoli and, because he didn't do the washing up, Dad never found out. Win all around!
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: The oldest tricks are the best. It's amazing how much of your most-hated vegetable you can hide under a simple knife and fork! And I got away with it, too!
